intro: Acronia glabra, commonly known as the smooth acronia, is a flowering plant native to parts of eastern North America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and umbel-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, woodland habitats and is known for its delicate, white to pale pink blooms. Acronia glabra is a perennial herb that can reach heights of up to 1 meter, with a smooth, hairless stem. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological studies and botanical gardens.
